intro: Alsine octandra, commonly known as the eight-angled alsike, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Alsine octandra is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters, making it a modest yet distinctive member of the flora in its native habitats.
